plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant known for its large, bright yellow flower heads that track the sun across the sky, symbolizing summer and warmth.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, especially North America and Europe
plants.funFact: Sunflowers can grow up to 3 meters tall and their flower heads are actually composed of hundreds of tiny flowers called florets.

plants.name: Rhododendron arboreum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree with large, bell-shaped clusters of red flowers, commonly found in mountainous regions.
plants.bloomingSeason: April to August (some varieties bloom into August)
plants.location: Himalayan region, including Nepal, Bhutan, and northern India
plants.funFact: Rhododendron arboreum is the national flower of Nepal and can grow up to 20 meters tall.

plants.name: Lavandula angustifolia
plants.description: A fragrant herbaceous shrub known for its spikes of purple-blue flowers and calming scent, often used in perfumes and aromatherapy.
plants.location: Mediterranean region and widely cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Lavender attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies, playing a crucial role in many garden ecosystems.

plants.name: Banksia menziesii
plants.description: A woody shrub or small tree unique to Australia, with distinctive cylindrical flower spikes consisting of numerous small flowers in shades of orange to red.
plants.funFact: Banksia flowers provide nectar that is an important food source for nectar-feeding birds and mammals in Australia.
